document.discussion_title: Trimble Navigation Limited (TRMB) Given “Buy” Rating at Oppenheimer
document.topic_text: Tweet Trimble Navigation Limited (NASDAQ:TRMB) ‘s stock had its “buy” rating reissued by research analysts at Oppenheimer in a research note issued on Monday, MarketBeat.Com reports. Shares of Trimble Navigation Limited ( NASDAQ:TRMB ) traded down 1.723% during midday trading on Monday, reaching $25.375. The company’s stock had a trading volume of 453,507 shares. Trimble Navigation Limited has a one year low of $15.90 and a one year high of $26.36. The stock has a market cap of $6.37 billion and a PE ratio of 53.989. The firm has a 50-day moving average of $24.97 and a 200-day moving average of $21.96. Trimble Navigation Limited (NASDAQ:TRMB) last announced its quarterly earnings data on Tuesday, February 9th. The company reported $0.27 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, topping the consensus estimate of $0.24 by $0.03. The firm earned $559.70 million during the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $544.36 million. During the same period last year, the company earned $0.29 EPS. The firm’s revenue for the quarter was down .7% compared to the same quarter last year. On average, analysts forecast that Trimble Navigation Limited will post $1.26 EPS for the current year. In other Trimble Navigation Limited news, VP James A. Kirkland sold 3,068 shares of the firm’s stock in a transaction that occurred on Friday, February 19th. The shares were sold at an average price of $23.37, for a total value of $71,699.16. Following the transaction, the vice president now directly owns 14,692 shares of the company’s stock, valued at approximately $343,352.04. The transaction was disclosed in a filing with the Securities & Exchange Commission, which is available at the SEC website . Also, VP James Veneziano sold 2,130 shares of the firm’s stock in a transaction that occurred on Tuesday, March 1st. The stock was sold at an average price of $24.52, for a total transaction of $52,227.60. Following the completion of the transaction, the vice president now directly owns 55,996 shares in the company, valued at $1,373,021.92. The disclosure for this sale can be found here . A number of hedge funds and institutional investors have added to or reduced their stakes in TRMB. Gulf International Bank UK Ltd raised its position in Trimble Navigation Limited by 0.6% in the fourth quarter. Gulf International Bank UK Ltd now owns 78,522 shares of the company’s stock worth $1,684,000 after buying an additional 500 shares during the period. KBC Group raised its stake in Trimble Navigation Limited by 1.1% in the third quarter. KBC Group now owns 68,231 shares of the company’s stock valued at $1,120,000 after buying an additional 725 shares during the last quarter. I.G. Investment Management LTD. raised its stake in Trimble Navigation Limited by 1.3% in the fourth quarter. I.G. Investment Management LTD. now owns 87,200 shares of the company’s stock valued at $1,870,000 after buying an additional 1,100 shares during the last quarter. Independent Portfolio Consultants Inc. raised its stake in Trimble Navigation Limited by 11.8% in the first quarter. Independent Portfolio Consultants Inc. now owns 14,185 shares of the company’s stock valued at $352,000 after buying an additional 1,495 shares during the last quarter. Finally, Fourth Swedish National Pension Fund raised its stake in Trimble Navigation Limited by 3.2% in the fourth quarter. Fourth Swedish National Pension Fund now owns 72,868 shares of the company’s stock valued at $1,563,000 after buying an additional 2,257 shares during the last quarter. TRMB has been the subject of a number of other research reports. William Blair lowered Trimble Navigation Limited from an “outperform” rating to a “market perform” rating in a report on Friday, April 1st. Goldman Sachs upgraded Trimble Navigation Limited from a “buy” rating to a “conviction-buy” rating and set a $29.00 target price for the company in a report on Thursday, February 25th. Piper Jaffray restated a “buy” rating on shares of Trimble Navigation Limited in a report on Sunday, December 27th. Wedbush restated an “outperform” rating and set a $28.00 target price on shares of Trimble Navigation Limited in a report on Thursday, February 11th. Finally, MKM Partners restated a “hold” rating and set a $21.00 target price (up previously from $20.00) on shares of Trimble Navigation Limited in a report on Monday, February 1st. Five investment analysts have rated the stock with a hold rating, six have given a buy rating and one has given a strong buy rating to the company’s stock. Trimble Navigation Limited presently has a consensus rating of “Buy” and an average price target of $24.91. Trimble Navigation Limited is a provider of technology solutions for professionals and field mobile workers. The Company operates through four segments: Engineering and Construction, Field Solutions, Mobile Solutions and Advanced Devices. The Engineering and Construction segment provides heavy civil construction, building construction and geospatial solutions.
